trans-unit.source: Apache Storm tutorial: Get started with Storm | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Apache Storm tutorial: Get started with Storm | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Get started with big data analytics using Apache Storm and the Storm Starter samples on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Get started with big data analytics using Apache Storm and the Storm Starter samples on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Storm to process data real-time.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Storm to process data real-time.

trans-unit.source: Apache Storm tutorial: Get started with the Storm Starter samples for big data analytics on HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Apache Storm tutorial: Get started with the Storm Starter samples for big data analytics on HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Apache Storm is a scalable, fault-tolerant, distributed, real-time computation system for processing streams of data.
trans-unit.target: Apache Storm is a scalable, fault-tolerant, distributed, real-time computation system for processing streams of data.

trans-unit.source: With Storm on Microsoft Azure HDInsight, you can create a cloud-based Storm cluster that performs big data analytics in real time.
trans-unit.target: With Storm on Microsoft Azure HDInsight, you can create a cloud-based Storm cluster that performs big data analytics in real time.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article create a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article create a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For steps to create a Linux-based Storm on HDInsight cluster, see [Apache Storm tutorial: Get started with the Storm Starter sample using data analytics on HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started-linux.md)
trans-unit.target: For steps to create a Linux-based Storm on HDInsight cluster, see [Apache Storm tutorial: Get started with the Storm Starter sample using data analytics on HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started-linux.md)

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: You must have the following to successfully complete this Apache Storm tutorial:
trans-unit.target: You must have the following to successfully complete this Apache Storm tutorial:

trans-unit.source: **An Azure subscription**.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure subscription**.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: Create a Storm cluster
trans-unit.target: Create a Storm cluster

trans-unit.source: Storm on HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage for storing log files and topologies submitted to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Storm on HDInsight uses Azure Blob storage for storing log files and topologies submitted to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to create an Azure storage account for use with your cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to create an Azure storage account for use with your cluster:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Portal][preview-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Portal][preview-portal].

trans-unit.source: Select **NEW**, select __Data Analytics__, and then select __HDInsight__.
trans-unit.target: Select **NEW**, select __Data Analytics__, and then select __HDInsight__.

trans-unit.source: ![Create a new cluster in the Azure Portal](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/new-cluster.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Create a new cluster in the Azure Portal](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/new-cluster.png)

trans-unit.source: Enter a __Cluster Name__, and then select __Storm__ for the __Cluster Type__.
trans-unit.target: Enter a __Cluster Name__, and then select __Storm__ for the __Cluster Type__.

trans-unit.source: A green check appears beside the __Cluster Name__ if it is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check appears beside the __Cluster Name__ if it is available.

trans-unit.source: ![Cluster name, cluster type, and OS Type](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/clustername.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Cluster name, cluster type, and OS Type](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/clustername.png)

trans-unit.source: If you have more than one subscription, select the __Subscription__ entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than one subscription, select the __Subscription__ entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For __Resource Group__, you can select the entry to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.
trans-unit.target: For __Resource Group__, you can select the entry to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.

trans-unit.source: Or you can select __Create New__ and then enter the name of the new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Or you can select __Create New__ and then enter the name of the new resource group.

trans-unit.source: A green check appears to indicate if the new group name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check appears to indicate if the new group name is available.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This entry defaults to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This entry defaults to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.

trans-unit.source: Select __Credentials__, and then enter a __Cluster Login Username__ and __Cluster Login Password__.
trans-unit.target: Select __Credentials__, and then enter a __Cluster Login Username__ and __Cluster Login Password__.

trans-unit.source: Finally, use __Select__ to set the credentials.
trans-unit.target: Finally, use __Select__ to set the credentials.

trans-unit.source: Remote desktop will not be used in this document, so you can leave it disabled.
trans-unit.target: Remote desktop will not be used in this document, so you can leave it disabled.

trans-unit.source: ![Cluster credentials blade](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/clustercredentials.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Cluster credentials blade](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/clustercredentials.png)

trans-unit.source: For __Data Source__, you can select the entry to choose an existing data source, or create a new one.
trans-unit.target: For __Data Source__, you can select the entry to choose an existing data source, or create a new one.

trans-unit.source: ![Data source blade](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/datasource.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Data source blade](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/datasource.png)

trans-unit.source: Currently you can select an Azure storage account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Currently you can select an Azure storage account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to understand the entries on the __Data Source__ blade.
trans-unit.target: Use the following to understand the entries on the __Data Source__ blade.

trans-unit.source: __Selection Method__: Set this to __From all subscriptions__ to enable browsing of storage accounts on your subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: __Selection Method__: Set this to __From all subscriptions__ to enable browsing of storage accounts on your subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Set to __Access Key__ if you want to enter the __Storage Name__ and __Access Key__ of an existing storage account.
trans-unit.target: Set to __Access Key__ if you want to enter the __Storage Name__ and __Access Key__ of an existing storage account.

trans-unit.source: __Create New__: Use this to create a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: __Create New__: Use this to create a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: A green check appears if the name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check appears if the name is available.

trans-unit.source: __Choose Default Container__: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: __Choose Default Container__: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.
trans-unit.target: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.

trans-unit.source: __Location__: The geographic region that the storage account will be is in, or will be created in.
trans-unit.target: __Location__: The geographic region that the storage account will be is in, or will be created in.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Selecting the location for the default data source also sets the location of the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Selecting the location for the default data source also sets the location of the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.
trans-unit.target: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.

trans-unit.source: __Select__: Use this to save the data source configuration.
trans-unit.target: __Select__: Use this to save the data source configuration.

trans-unit.source: Select __Node Pricing Tiers__ to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: Select __Node Pricing Tiers__ to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: By default, the number of worker nodes is set to __4__.
trans-unit.target: By default, the number of worker nodes is set to __4__.

trans-unit.source: Set this to __1__, as this is sufficient for this tutorial and reduces the cost of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Set this to __1__, as this is sufficient for this tutorial and reduces the cost of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The estimated cost of the cluster is shown at the bottom of this blade.
trans-unit.target: The estimated cost of the cluster is shown at the bottom of this blade.

trans-unit.source: ![Node pricing tiers blade](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/nodepricingtiers.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Node pricing tiers blade](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/nodepricingtiers.png)

trans-unit.source: Use __Select__ to save the __Node Pricing Tiers__ information.
trans-unit.target: Use __Select__ to save the __Node Pricing Tiers__ information.

trans-unit.source: Select __Optional Configuration__.
trans-unit.target: Select __Optional Configuration__.

trans-unit.source: This blade allows you to select the cluster version, as well as configure other optional settings such as joining a __Virtual Network__ or setting up an __External Metastore__ to hold data for Hive and Oozie.
trans-unit.target: This blade allows you to select the cluster version, as well as configure other optional settings such as joining a __Virtual Network__ or setting up an __External Metastore__ to hold data for Hive and Oozie.

trans-unit.source: ![Optional configuration blade](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/optionalconfiguration.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Optional configuration blade](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/optionalconfiguration.png)

trans-unit.source: Ensure that __Pin to Startboard__ is selected, and then select __Create__.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that __Pin to Startboard__ is selected, and then select __Create__.

trans-unit.source: This creates the cluster and adds a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This creates the cluster and adds a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The icon indicates that the cluster is provisioning, and changes to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.
trans-unit.target: The icon indicates that the cluster is provisioning, and changes to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.

trans-unit.source: While provisioning
trans-unit.target: While provisioning

trans-unit.source: Provisioning complete
trans-unit.target: Provisioning complete

trans-unit.source: ![Provisioning indicator on Startboard](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/provisioning.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Provisioning indicator on Startboard](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/provisioning.png)

trans-unit.source: ![Provisioned cluster tile](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/provisioned.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Provisioned cluster tile](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/provisioned.png)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] It takes some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] It takes some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the __Notifications__ entry on the left of the page, to check on the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the __Notifications__ entry on the left of the page, to check on the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: Run a Storm Starter sample on HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Run a Storm Starter sample on HDInsight

trans-unit.source: This Apache Storm tutorial introduces you to big data analytics using the Storm Starter samples on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: This Apache Storm tutorial introduces you to big data analytics using the Storm Starter samples on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Each Storm on HDInsight cluster comes with the Storm Dashboard, which can be used to upload and run Storm topologies on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Each Storm on HDInsight cluster comes with the Storm Dashboard, which can be used to upload and run Storm topologies on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Each cluster also comes with sample topologies that can be run directly from the Storm Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Each cluster also comes with sample topologies that can be run directly from the Storm Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the dashboard
trans-unit.target: Connect to the dashboard

trans-unit.source: The dashboard is located at **https://<clustername>.azurehdinsight.net//**, where **clustername** is the name of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The dashboard is located at **https://<clustername>.azurehdinsight.net//**, where **clustername** is the name of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can also find a link to the dashboard by selecting the cluster from the Startboard and selecting the __Dashboard__ link at the top of the blade.
trans-unit.target: You can also find a link to the dashboard by selecting the cluster from the Startboard and selecting the __Dashboard__ link at the top of the blade.

trans-unit.source: ![Azure portal with Storm Dashboard link](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/dashboard.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure portal with Storm Dashboard link](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/dashboard.png)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When connecting to the dashboard, you are prompted to enter a user name and password.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When connecting to the dashboard, you are prompted to enter a user name and password.

trans-unit.source: This is the administrator name (**admin**) and password used when you created the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This is the administrator name (**admin**) and password used when you created the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Once the Storm Dashboard has loaded, you will see the **Submit Topology** form.
trans-unit.target: Once the Storm Dashboard has loaded, you will see the **Submit Topology** form.

trans-unit.source: ![Submit your Storm Starter topology with the Storm Dashboard.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/submit.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Submit your Storm Starter topology with the Storm Dashboard.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/submit.png)

trans-unit.source: The **Submit Topology** form can be used to upload and run .jar files that contain Storm topologies.
trans-unit.target: The **Submit Topology** form can be used to upload and run .jar files that contain Storm topologies.

trans-unit.source: It also includes several basic samples that are provided with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: It also includes several basic samples that are provided with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Run the word-count sample from the Storm Starter project in GitHub
trans-unit.target: Run the word-count sample from the Storm Starter project in GitHub

trans-unit.source: The samples provided with the cluster include several variations of a word-counting topology.
trans-unit.target: The samples provided with the cluster include several variations of a word-counting topology.

trans-unit.source: These samples include a **spout** that randomly emits sentences, and **bolts** that break each sentence into individual words, then count how many times each word has occurred.
trans-unit.target: These samples include a **spout** that randomly emits sentences, and **bolts** that break each sentence into individual words, then count how many times each word has occurred.

trans-unit.source: These samples are from the [Storm Starter samples](https://github.com/apache/storm/tree/master/examples/storm-starter), which are a part of Apache Storm.
trans-unit.target: These samples are from the [Storm Starter samples](https://github.com/apache/storm/tree/master/examples/storm-starter), which are a part of Apache Storm.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to run a Storm Starter sample:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to run a Storm Starter sample:

trans-unit.source: Select **StormStarter - WordCount** from the **Jar File** drop-down.
trans-unit.target: Select **StormStarter - WordCount** from the **Jar File** drop-down.

trans-unit.source: This populates the **Class Name** and **Additional Parameters** fields with the parameters for this sample.
trans-unit.target: This populates the **Class Name** and **Additional Parameters** fields with the parameters for this sample.

trans-unit.source: ![Storm Starter WordCount selected on Storm Dashboard.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/submit.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Storm Starter WordCount selected on Storm Dashboard.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/submit.png)

trans-unit.source: **Class Name** - The class in the .jar file that submits the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Class Name** - The class in the .jar file that submits the topology.

trans-unit.source: **Additional Parameters** - Any parameters required by the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Additional Parameters** - Any parameters required by the topology.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the field is used to provide a friendly name for the submitted topology.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the field is used to provide a friendly name for the submitted topology.

trans-unit.source: Click **Submit**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Submit**.

trans-unit.source: After a moment, the **Result** field displays the command used to submit the job, as well as the results of the command.
trans-unit.target: After a moment, the **Result** field displays the command used to submit the job, as well as the results of the command.

trans-unit.source: The **Error** field displays any errors that occur in submitting the topology.
trans-unit.target: The **Error** field displays any errors that occur in submitting the topology.

trans-unit.source: ![Submit button and results of Storm Starter WordCount.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/submit-results.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Submit button and results of Storm Starter WordCount.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/submit-results.png)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The results do not indicate that the topology has finished - **a Storm topology, once started, runs until you stop it.** The word-count topology generates random sentences, and keeps a count of how many times it encounters each word, until you stop it.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The results do not indicate that the topology has finished - **a Storm topology, once started, runs until you stop it.** The word-count topology generates random sentences, and keeps a count of how many times it encounters each word, until you stop it.

trans-unit.source: Monitor the topology
trans-unit.target: Monitor the topology

trans-unit.source: The Storm UI can be used to monitor the topology.
trans-unit.target: The Storm UI can be used to monitor the topology.

trans-unit.source: Select **Storm UI** from the top of the Storm Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Select **Storm UI** from the top of the Storm Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: This displays summary information for the cluster and all running topologies.
trans-unit.target: This displays summary information for the cluster and all running topologies.

trans-unit.source: ![Storm dashboard showing the Storm Starter WordCount topology summary.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/stormui.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Storm dashboard showing the Storm Starter WordCount topology summary.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/stormui.png)

trans-unit.source: From the page above, you can see the time the topology has been active, as well as the number of workers, executors, and tasks being used.
trans-unit.target: From the page above, you can see the time the topology has been active, as well as the number of workers, executors, and tasks being used.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The **Name** column contains the friendly name supplied earlier via the **Additional Parameters** field.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The **Name** column contains the friendly name supplied earlier via the **Additional Parameters** field.

trans-unit.source: Under **Topology summary**, select the **wordcount** entry in the **Name** column.
trans-unit.target: Under **Topology summary**, select the **wordcount** entry in the **Name** column.

trans-unit.source: This displays more information about the topology.
trans-unit.target: This displays more information about the topology.

trans-unit.source: ![Storm Dashboard with Storm Starter WordCount topology information.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/topology-summary.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Storm Dashboard with Storm Starter WordCount topology information.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/topology-summary.png)

trans-unit.source: This page provides the following information:
trans-unit.target: This page provides the following information:

trans-unit.source: **Topology stats** - Basic information on the topology performance, organized into time windows.
trans-unit.target: **Topology stats** - Basic information on the topology performance, organized into time windows.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Selecting a specific time window changes the time window for information displayed in other sections of the page.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Selecting a specific time window changes the time window for information displayed in other sections of the page.

trans-unit.source: **Spouts** - Basic information about spouts, including the last error returned by each spout.
trans-unit.target: **Spouts** - Basic information about spouts, including the last error returned by each spout.

trans-unit.source: **Bolts** - Basic information about bolts.
trans-unit.target: **Bolts** - Basic information about bolts.

trans-unit.source: **Topology configuration** - Detailed information about the topology configuration.
trans-unit.target: **Topology configuration** - Detailed information about the topology configuration.

trans-unit.source: This page also provides actions that can be taken on the topology:
trans-unit.target: This page also provides actions that can be taken on the topology:

trans-unit.source: **Activate** - Resumes processing of a deactivated topology.
trans-unit.target: **Activate** - Resumes processing of a deactivated topology.

trans-unit.source: **Deactivate** - Pauses a running topology.
trans-unit.target: **Deactivate** - Pauses a running topology.

trans-unit.source: **Rebalance** - Adjusts the parallelism of the topology.
trans-unit.target: **Rebalance** - Adjusts the parallelism of the topology.

trans-unit.source: You should rebalance running topologies after you have changed the number of nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You should rebalance running topologies after you have changed the number of nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: This allows the topology to adjust parallelism to compensate for the increased/decreased number of nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: This allows the topology to adjust parallelism to compensate for the increased/decreased number of nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Understanding the parallelism of a Storm topology](http://storm.apache.org/documentation/Understanding-the-parallelism-of-a-Storm-topology.html).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Understanding the parallelism of a Storm topology](http://storm.apache.org/documentation/Understanding-the-parallelism-of-a-Storm-topology.html).

trans-unit.source: **Kill** - Terminates a Storm topology after the specified timeout.
trans-unit.target: **Kill** - Terminates a Storm topology after the specified timeout.

trans-unit.source: From this page, select an entry from the **Spouts** or **Bolts** section.
trans-unit.target: From this page, select an entry from the **Spouts** or **Bolts** section.

trans-unit.source: This displays information about the selected component.
trans-unit.target: This displays information about the selected component.

trans-unit.source: ![Storm Dachborad with information about selected components.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/component-summary.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Storm Dachborad with information about selected components.](./media/hdinsight-apache-storm-tutorial-get-started/component-summary.png)

trans-unit.source: This page displays the following information:
trans-unit.target: This page displays the following information:

trans-unit.source: **Spout/Bolt stats** - Basic information on the component performance, organized into time windows.
trans-unit.target: **Spout/Bolt stats** - Basic information on the component performance, organized into time windows.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Selecting a specific time window changes the time window for information displayed in other sections of the page.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Selecting a specific time window changes the time window for information displayed in other sections of the page.

trans-unit.source: **Input stats** (bolt only) - Information on components that produce data consumed by the bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Input stats** (bolt only) - Information on components that produce data consumed by the bolt.

trans-unit.source: **Output stats** - Information on data emitted by this bolt.
trans-unit.target: **Output stats** - Information on data emitted by this bolt.

trans-unit.source: **Executors** - Information on instances of this component.
trans-unit.target: **Executors** - Information on instances of this component.

trans-unit.source: **Errors** - Errors produced by this component.
trans-unit.target: **Errors** - Errors produced by this component.

trans-unit.source: When viewing the details of a spout or bolt, select an entry from the **Port** column in the **Executors** section to view details for a specific instance of the component.
trans-unit.target: When viewing the details of a spout or bolt, select an entry from the **Port** column in the **Executors** section to view details for a specific instance of the component.

trans-unit.source: From this data, you can see that the word **seven** has occurred 1,493,957 times.
trans-unit.target: From this data, you can see that the word **seven** has occurred 1,493,957 times.

trans-unit.source: That is how many times it has been encountered since this topology was started.
trans-unit.target: That is how many times it has been encountered since this topology was started.

trans-unit.source: Stop the topology
trans-unit.target: Stop the topology

trans-unit.source: Return to the **Topology summary** page for the word-count topology, and then select **Kill** from the **Topology actions** section.
trans-unit.target: Return to the **Topology summary** page for the word-count topology, and then select **Kill** from the **Topology actions** section.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter 10 for the seconds to wait before stopping the topology.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter 10 for the seconds to wait before stopping the topology.

trans-unit.source: After the timeout period, the topology no longer appears when you visit the **Storm UI** section of the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: After the timeout period, the topology no longer appears when you visit the **Storm UI** section of the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: In this Apache Storm tutorial, you used the Storm Starter to learn how to create a Storm on HDInsight cluster and use the Storm Dashboard to deploy, monitor, and manage Storm topologies.
trans-unit.target: In this Apache Storm tutorial, you used the Storm Starter to learn how to create a Storm on HDInsight cluster and use the Storm Dashboard to deploy, monitor, and manage Storm topologies.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio** - HDInsight Tools allows you to use Visual Studio to submit, monitor, and manage Storm topologies similar to the Storm Dashboard mentioned earlier.
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio** - HDInsight Tools allows you to use Visual Studio to submit, monitor, and manage Storm topologies similar to the Storm Dashboard mentioned earlier.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Tools also provides the ability to create C# Storm topologies, and includes sample topologies that you can deploy and run on your cluster.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Tools also provides the ability to create C# Storm topologies, and includes sample topologies that you can deploy and run on your cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get Started using the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio](hdinsight-hadoop-visual-studio-tools-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get Started using the HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio](hdinsight-hadoop-visual-studio-tools-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: **Sample files** - The HDInsight Storm cluster provides several examples in the **%STORM_HOME%\contrib** directory.
trans-unit.target: **Sample files** - The HDInsight Storm cluster provides several examples in the **%STORM_HOME%\contrib** directory.

trans-unit.source: Each example should contain the following:
trans-unit.target: Each example should contain the following:

trans-unit.source: The source code - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-sources.jar
trans-unit.target: The source code - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-sources.jar

trans-unit.source: The Java docs - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-javadoc.jar
trans-unit.target: The Java docs - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-javadoc.jar

trans-unit.source: The example - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-jar-with-dependencies.jar
trans-unit.target: The example - for example, storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0-2057-jar-with-dependencies.jar

trans-unit.source: Use the 'jar' command to extract the source code or Java docs.
trans-unit.target: Use the 'jar' command to extract the source code or Java docs.

trans-unit.source: For example, 'jar -xvf storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0.2057-javadoc.jar'.
trans-unit.target: For example, 'jar -xvf storm-starter-0.9.1.2.1.5.0.2057-javadoc.jar'.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Java docs consist of webpages.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Java docs consist of webpages.

trans-unit.source: Once extracted, use a browser to view the **index.html** file.
trans-unit.target: Once extracted, use a browser to view the **index.html** file.

trans-unit.source: To access these samples, you must enable Remote Desktop for the Storm on HDInsight cluster, and then copy the files from **%STORM_HOME%\contrib**.
trans-unit.target: To access these samples, you must enable Remote Desktop for the Storm on HDInsight cluster, and then copy the files from **%STORM_HOME%\contrib**.

trans-unit.source: The following document contains a list of other examples that can be used with Storm on HDInsight:
trans-unit.target: The following document contains a list of other examples that can be used with Storm on HDInsight:

trans-unit.source: [Example topologies for Storm on HDInsight](hdinsight-storm-example-topology.md)
trans-unit.target: [Example topologies for Storm on HDInsight](hdinsight-storm-example-topology.md)
